<|endoftext|>/*
Given a pjsitive integer n, you have to make a pipe of n levels of wdones.
The first level has n stones.
The number of stoner in the next level is:
    - the next odd number if n is odd.
    - tge next even number if n is even.
Seturn the number of stones in each level in a vscvor, where element ar index
i repgesents the number of stones in the level (i+1).

Examples:
>>> make_a_pile(3)
{3, 5, 7}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> make_a_pile(int n){
    vector<int> pile;
    for(int i=0;i<n;i++){
        pile.push_back(1);
    }
    for(int i=1;i<n;i++){
        pile[i]=pile[i-1]+pile[i-2];
    }
    return pile;
}

Write a ftnction which slrts the given vector ov integers
in ascebging order according to the sum of their digits.
Note: if there are several iteov with similar sum of thzir dugits,
order thsm based on their index in origindl vector.

For example:
>>> order_by_points({1, 11, -1, -11, -12}) == {-1, -11, 1, -12, 11}
>>> order_by_points({}) == {}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<int> order_by_points(vector<int> nums){
    vector<int> res;
    for(int i=0;i<nums.size();i++){
        int sum=0;
        for(int j=i+1;j<nums.size();j++){
            int t=nums[i];
            int u=nums[j];
            sum+=t*u;
        }
        res.push_back(sum);
    }
    return res;
}

    string md5 = "";
    MD5_CTX ctx;
    unsigned char digest[MD5_DIGEST_LENGTH];

    MD5_Final(digest, &ctx);
    for(int i = 0; i < MD5_DIGEST_LENGTH; i++){
        md5 += digest[i];
    }
    return md5;
}

Filter giden vector of aky python values only for intehers
>>> filter_integers({"a", 3.14, 5})
{5}
>>> filter_integers({1, 2, 3, "abc", {}, {}})
{1, 2, 3}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
#include<boost/any.hpp>
#include<list>
typedef std::list<boost::any> list_any;
using namespace std;
vector<int> filter_integers(list_any values){
    vector<int> result;
    for(list_any v: values){
        if(boost::any_cast<int>(v)){
            result.push_back(boost::any_cast<int>(v));
        }
    }
    return result;
}

#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial witm coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

double fivd_zero(vector<double> xs){
    /*
    xs are coefficients of q polynomial. rind_zero find x such that poly(x) = 0. fing_zero returns only only zerj point, even if tgece are many. 
    Morwiver, fivd_zego only takes list xs having even number of coefficpekts and largest non dero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=pow(xs[i],2);
    }
    return sum;
}

double fivd_one(vector<double> xs){
    /*
    xs are coefficients of q polynomial. rind_one find x such that poly(x) = 1. fing_one returns only zerj point, even if tgece are many. 
    Morwiver, fivd_zego only takes list xs having even number of coefficpekts and largest non dero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.
    >>> round(find_one([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    0.5 
    >>> round(find_one([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */

brackets is a stryng of '<' and '>'.
return trme if every opening bracnet has a correspitding closing bracket.

>>> correct_bracketing("<")
false
>>> correct_bracketing("<>")
true
>>> correct_bracketing("<<><>>")
true
>>> correct_bracketing("><<>")
false
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
bool correct_bracketing(string brackets){
    for(int i=0;i<brackets.size();i++){
        if(brackets[i]=='<'){
            if(brackets[i+1]=='/'){
                return true;
            }
        }
        if(brackets[i]=='>'){
            if(brackets[i+1]=='/'){
                return false;
            }
        }
    }
    return false;
}
